content: used in the commas are used to edging separate stitches stitches in these brackets are repeated e g dc9 sc3 dc1 sc3 dc9 x 2 repeat the group of stitches in brackets twice there may be a repeat group within another repeat group e g sc9 dc1 sc1 x 3 dc1 x 2 this whole group is repeated twice and within each whole group the dc1 sc1 are repeated 3 times 2 © mini christmas gift bag crochet pattern by carolannecreates general mosaic notes  every round is worked on the front side only  all the scs across each round are worked in the back loop  all the dcs are worked into the front loop of the stitch 2 rounds directly below  when working a double_crochet always skip the stitch behind the double_crochet at times when there are a number of dcs together there will be a number of scs not worked into which are sitting behind the dcs this is normal and the work will flatten out after a few rounds  every round is worked in one colour the colours are alternated and referred to as a and b in the written pattern and on the chart a is the background colour and b is the pattern colour chart notes  every box represents one stitch  in all the empty squares work an single_crochet in the back loop ignore the colour of the square they are only coloured or not so the pattern can be seen  where there is a square with an x work a double_crochet in the front loop of the stitch 2 rounds directly below  start from the bottom of the chart and from right to left if you are left-handed work from left to right work your way up the chart  a and b down the side of the chart represent your 2 contrasting colours they are alternated as you go up the chart  foundation row or chains and r1 are worked in colour a  see chart legend for further information yarn used in pictured sample all yarn used is scheepjes catona catona is 100% mercerised cotton and has 125 metres 137 yards for a 50g ball colour numbers are in brackets colour a petrol blue 400 28g 70m/77yds 1 skein colour b snow white 106 17g 43m/47yds 1 skein 3 © mini christmas gift bag crochet pattern by carolannecreates top tip stitch markers are your friend place one in the first stitch of each round and the last stitch of the first repeat to help you keep your place and keep track of stitches instructions notes  gift bag is worked in the round like a tube see video link below for the join  the first section the mosaic section can be worked from the chart or the following written instructions the same design is on both sides of the bag  the next section is the band with the
